page.title: 12Dairy Farming
page.content: The majority of dairy farming in our area is of a very high standard. There are two different kinds of cows, dry cows and wet cows.Dry cows are cows that don't give milk because they are pregnant. Wet cows are cows that are not pregnant and give milk. Although lots of milk is produced much of it does'nt pass the lips of many people in our area.Some of it is collected by milk tankers and transported to other places. Dairy farms in our area include ,Thistle Brook Folly,Church,Cane End and Baileys farm.Church and Cane End farms are in Hulcott near Bierton.Some farms have sheep as well but don't breed them as they breed cows.
